input_sentence: It is always the case that if the other vehicle is to the left of the ego vehicle and the ego vehicle drives faster than the other vehicle, then the ego vehicle is to the right of a broad lane marking and the other vehicle is to the left of a solid lane marking.

atomic_propositions.description: Other vehicle is to the left of ego vehicle
Ego vehicle drives faster than other vehicle
Ego vehicle is to the right of broad lane marking
Other vehicle is to the left of solid lane marking

temporal_relations.description: If other vehicle is left of ego and ego drives faster, then ego is right of broad lane marking and other is left of solid lane marking

lexicon.other_left_of_ego: Other vehicle is to the left of ego vehicle
lexicon.ego_faster_than_other: Ego vehicle drives faster than other vehicle
lexicon.ego_right_of_broad: Ego vehicle is to the right of broad lane marking
lexicon.other_left_of_solid: Other vehicle is to the left of solid lane marking

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other  
   - obj_broad_lane_marking → broad_lane_marking
   - obj_solid_lane_marking → solid_lane_marking

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: in_left_of(other,ego)
   - ap_2: drives_faster_than(ego,other)
   - ap_3: in_right_of(ego,broad_lane_marking)
   - ap_4: in_left_of(other,solid_lane_marking)

3. Build conditional relation from temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: in_left_of(other,ego) & drives_faster_than(ego,other)
   - Consequent: in_right_of(ego,broad_lane_marking) & in_left_of(other,solid_lane_marking)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

Final MTL Formula:
G ((in_left_of(other,ego) & drives_faster_than(ego,other)) -> (in_right_of(ego,broad_lane_marking) & in_left_of(other,solid_lane_marking)))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other  
   - obj_broad_lane_marking → broad_lane_marking
   - obj_solid_lane_marking → solid_lane_marking

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: in_left_of(other,ego)
   - ap_2: drives_faster_than(ego,other)
   - ap_3: in_right_of(ego,broad_lane_marking)
   - ap_4: in_left_of(other,solid_lane_marking)

3. Build conditional relation from temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: in_left_of(other,ego) & drives_faster_than(ego,other)
   - Consequent: in_right_of(ego,broad_lane_marking) & in_left_of(other,solid_lane_marking)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula begins with the global operator `G`, indicating an "Always" condition that must hold at all times.
- The implication `->` structure means "if [condition], then [consequence]".
- The condition contains two relational predicates connected by `&` (and):
  - `in_left_of(other,ego)` translates to "another vehicle is to the left of the ego vehicle"
  - `drives_faster_than(ego,other)` translates to "the ego vehicle drives faster than the other vehicle"
- The consequence contains two relational predicates connected by `&` (and):
  - `in_right_of(ego,broad_lane_marking)` translates to "the ego vehicle is to the right of a broad lane marking"
  - `in_left_of(other,solid_lane_marking)` translates to "the other vehicle is to the left of a solid lane marking"
- All predicates maintain their specific object references as required by the interpretation rules.

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if another vehicle is to the left of the ego vehicle and the ego vehicle drives faster than the other vehicle, then the ego vehicle must be to the right of a broad lane marking and the other vehicle must be to the left of a solid lane marking.

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components
